Blog.post: urlLink This is part of the grounds at the Hilton--it's just humongous and so beautiful. There are really nice walking paths with hammocks along the way strung between palm trees where you can just relax for a bit or take a nap. urlLink
urlLink There is a boat you can take to get to your room, or you can take the train. This is the boat going by the tower that my room was in. urlLink
urlLink Our first evening there, we went to a little grocery shopping near the hotel area (Waikoloa Village) and had our dinner outside with this view! urlLink

urlLink After my initial shock over Waikoloa Village wore off, Kim and I went the next morning to the volcano. We saw the crater (much smaller than Ngorongoro, but still cool!) and we drove down to the area with the freshest lava where you can hike around on it. urlLink
urlLink This is the flow from last year where it covered more of the road! The other side is completely blocked off by years of lava. urlLink
urlLink The next day, Kim and I went snorkeling...and here is a lovely bathing beauty. urlLink

urlLink We saw lots of different fish, including the humuhumunukunukuapua'a fish ( ridiculously hard to photograph because they're elusive and very speedy). Luckily, yellow tangs were abundant and apparently slow-moving. urlLink
urlLink The next day we woke up butt early for the race (2:15 am)! I stopped on the race course to pose for a picture. I think this is at about mile 3 or 4. urlLink
urlLink Kim and me after successfully finishing the half marathon! I was 31st in my division...not too bad! urlLink

urlLink After we went back to the hotel, I was exhausted though it was only about 10 or 11 am! I took a nap and then did some snorkeling in the lagoon at the Hilton where I met this puffer fish. urlLink
urlLink Before we left for the airport the next day, Kim and I took one last walk around the hotel and saw two green sea turtles swim right under the bridge we were on! urlLink
urlLink A very beautiful view on our last walk around the Hilton grounds. urlLink
